metadata.Title: CVE-2020-29562 on Ubuntu 21.10 (impish) - low.
metadata.Description:
The iconv function in the GNU C Library (aka glibc or libc6) 2.30 to 2.32, when converting UCS4 text containing an irreversible character, fails an assertion in the code path and aborts the program, potentially resulting in a denial of service.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo ua fix CVE-2020-29562` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

glibc-source - 2.33-0ubuntu1
libc-bin - 2.33-0ubuntu1
libc6 - 2.33-0ubuntu1
libc6-amd64 - 2.33-0ubuntu1
libc6-i386 - 2.33-0ubuntu1
libc6-prof - 2.33-0ubuntu1
libc6-s390 - 2.33-0ubuntu1
libc6-x32 - 2.33-0ubuntu1
locales - 2.33-0ubuntu1
locales-all - 2.33-0ubuntu1
nscd - 2.33-0ubuntu1
No subscription required

notes.Note: mdeslaur> while bug reports indicate this was introduced in 2.30, there actually is a commit in 2.27 to fix the issue.

criterions.comment: glibc package in impish, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '2.33-0ubuntu1').
